intro: Platyclinis insectifera, commonly known as the insect-bearing flat-leaf plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its name "insectifera" refers to its ability to attract and support various insect species, contributing to its ecological significance. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and its role in pollinator habitats.
